business.headline: Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

Budget 2026: From mental health to medtech, healthcare seeks policy pushAhead of Union Budget 2026, voices from across the healthcare ecosystem are drawing attention to long-standing gaps. While funding has improved in recent years, experts say sharper policy focus is needed on mental health, medtech and early diagnosis.

Supreme Court rules Tiger Global must pay tax on $1.6 billion Flipkart-Walmart dealThe top court ruled that Tiger Global is not entitled to claim tax exemption under the India–Mauritius treaty. It agreed with the Income Tax Department's view that the structure used for the transaction was aimed at avoiding tax liability in India.

Budget 2026: Edtech and adtech seek policy support for AI-led growthWith artificial intelligence playing a growing role in education and digital advertising, industry leaders are looking to Budget 2026 for policy measures that support innovation, skills development and sustainable growth.

India and EU inch closer to finalising trade deal: ReportSenior European Union leaders are set to attend India's Republic Day celebrations on January 26, followed by the India–EU Summit on January 27, where the trade deal is expected to be a key topic.

Budget 2026: Is the old income tax regime slowly on its way out?As Union Budget 2026 draws closer, taxpayers are wondering whether the old income tax regime is nearing a phase-out. While it still exists today, many are questioning whether continued policy support for the new regime signals a gradual discontinuation of the old one.

Can Budget 2026 turn household gold into economic growth?India holds a vast amount of gold in households, much of which remains unused for economic activity. As Budget 2026 approaches, experts believe the government has an opportunity to turn this idle wealth into a driver of growth.

Can Budget 2026 unlock the next phase of India's clean energy transition?With targeted actions from the upcoming Union Budget, India's energy sector could move beyond capacity building and towards more reliable, flexible, and competitive clean power for industrial and commercial consumers nationwide.

For a local poll? Zerodha CEO slams poor planning as markets shut for BMC electionNithin Kamath's comments come on a day when Dalal Street is closed after the Maharashtra government declared January 15 a public holiday to ensure smooth polling for local body elections.

Waiting for BCCL shares? Check your allotment status, expected profit hereBCCL shares: The allotment status is now available, and investors can check whether they have received shares in the first mainboard IPO of 2026, which saw massive demand during the subscription period.
BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Indian stock markets will remain closed for a total of 16 days in 2026. January 26 will be the next market holiday this month.

Budget 2026: Will tax reforms and clearer rules revive India's crypto market?With the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, the virtual digital asset sector is hoping for changes that can ease taxation and provide regulatory certainty. Experts believe this could reignite growth in India's crypto ecosystem.

Wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December as prices firm upFood prices showed mixed trends during the month. Wholesale food inflation remained flat in December, compared with a sharp 2.6% decline recorded in November.

Trust, targets and commissions: How senior citizens are trapped by mis-sold insuranceHandcrafted ByOur Editors Senior citizens walk into banks seeking safety and certainty. Too often, they walk out with complex insurance products that quietly put their savings and peace of mind at risk.

Budget 2026: What real estate sector expects on housing, tax relief and infraWith the Union Budget 2026 around the corner, real estate developers are hoping for policy steps that improve affordability, simplify taxes and strengthen urban infrastructure to support long-term growth.

Buying an LIC policy? Here's where your money goes and what you get backWith assets under management of over Rs 57 lakh crore, LIC is not just an insurance company but also one of India's biggest long-term investors.
Sensex ends 245 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; TCS down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 244.98 points to close at 83,382.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 66.70 points to end at 25,665.60.

US targets Iran trading partners with 25% tariff: Will India be impacted?Markets in India have turned cautious as investors assess whether stricter US penalties on countries trading with Iran could have a spillover impact on Indian exporters, oil trade and overall market sentiment.

When can you withdraw 100% of your PF money? EPFO rules explainedWithdrawing your provident fund money has often felt complicated for many employees. Recent changes by EPFO now clearly explain when members can withdraw their full PF balance.

Will Budget 2026 simplify tax rules for investors?As policymakers prepare Budget 2026, tax experts and investors are hoping for tax changes that make savings and investments simpler, fairer and more predictable.

entertainment.headline: Harry Styles announces new album 'Kiss All The Time. Disco, Occasionally'. Details Singer Harry Styles has confirmed a new album, titled 'Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally'. in an announcement that sets his musical direction for 2026.

Honey Singh 'sorry' for viral explicit words: Meant to promote safe sex among Gen Z Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh issued a public apology after a remark made at a Delhi concert sparked criticism. In his video message, Honey Singh explained his intention behind the remark and claimed it was wrongly perceived by some people.

Wheel of Fortune India promo: Akshay Kumar hosts as contestants spin for big prize The makers of the upcoming show 'Wheel of Fortune India' shared a new promo that features Akshay Kumar taking charge as the host. The show will air on Sony TV on January 27.

Hollywood wasn't fool to vote: AR Rahman on Slumdog Millionaire being his finest AR Rahman, in a recent interview, defended his music in 'Slumdog Millionaire'. He called the soundtrack his finest work in Hollywood.

Watch: Arslan Goni grabs Sussanne Khan's phone, shows Hrithik Roshan on video call Sussanne Khan and Hrithik Roshan, who continue to share a cordial bond post-divorce, caught fans' attention once again with Sussanne's latest gesture at the airport. Watch the video here.

Kalamkaval OTT release: When and where to watch Mammootty's crime-thriller Mammootty's crime-thriller 'Kalamkaval' has been released on OTT. The film, directed by Jithin K Jose also features Vinayakan in a pivotal character.

Jana Nayagan makers eye Republic Day box office window if court case clears: Report Vijay's Jana Nayagan eyes a Republic Day release as makers wait for a hearing in the Madras High Court against the stay on the film's censor certificate.
Anupam Kher's witty fan encounter on Khosla Ka Ghosla 2 sets. Watch Anupam Kher shared a fun BTS moment from the sets of 'Khosla Ka Khosla 2'. The film is currently shot in Delhi with Boman Irani.

AR Rahman on Bollywood music scene: People who are not creative have the power now AR Rahman has addressed recent industry shifts that have impacted his work. He said the music industry has changed, with non-creative people now holding more power. The music composer also shared that he felt like an outsider in Bollywood until Taal helped him truly belong.

Stebin-Nupur's dreamy first dance from their Christian wedding goes viral. Watch Nupur Sanon and Stebin Ben's recent wedding in Udaipur has gone viral, showing the couple's first dance and family performances, including sister Kriti Sanon joining the celebrations.

Humein kya haraoge...: Sunny Deol's fiery warning to Pakistan in Border 2 trailer Sunny Deol brings back his commanding presence in the Border 2 trailer, delivering a fiery dialogue aimed at Pakistan during the 1971 war.

Naari Naari Naduma Murari review: Sharwanand and Naresh carry a smartly written comedyRelease Date:Thu Jan 15, 2026 A low-buzz Sankranthi release, Naari Naari Naduma Murari quietly delivers a smart, clean family entertainer that relies on situational comedy, strong character writing, and a fresh core idea rather than noise or scale.

Get set for Dunesday: Avengers Doomsday to clash with Dune 3 in December. Details Robert Downey Jr wants 2026 Christmas to be a 'Dunesday' box office event similar to 'Barbenheimer'. He spoke about the clash with Timothée Chalamet's 'Dune: Part 3' and 'Avengers: Doomsday'.

Border 2 trailer: Sunny Deol brings scale and sacrifice in multi-front war drama Border 2 trailer: The trailer for the Aurag Singh directorial was released on Army Day, showcasing India's 1971 war across land, sea and air, with Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahaan Panday and Diljit Dosanjh.
The 50: Karan Patel confirms participation in Farah Khan's show Actor Karan Patel has confirmed his participation in the Farah Khan-hosted show 'The 50.' The show will air on February 1 on Colors.

Can Rahu Ketu's quirky comedy shine amid Dhurandhar's box-office dominance? Rahu Ketu blends Indian mythology with situational humour, aiming to carve its niche amid Dhurandhar's box-office reign. Led by Varun Sharma and Pulkit Samrat, the film offers a much-needed light-hearted break for audiences craving genuine laughs.

Tokyo goes wild as Allu Arjun says Pushpa 2 dialogue in Japanese Allu Arjun wowed audiences at the Tokyo premiere of Pushpa 2: The Rule by delivering his Japanese dialogue live, prompting loud cheers from fans. The film releases in Japan on January 16, adding to the rising global interest in Indian cinema.

Haryana Police ban 67 gangster songs; Masoom Sharma tops list with 19 tracks In a major crackdown, the Haryana Police STF has removed 67 songs by 20 singers from digital platforms to curb the glorification of gangster culture. Singer Masoom Sharma tops the list with 19 tracks blocked for promoting violence and illegal weapons.

History was always politicised: Nikkhil Advani opens up on Freedom at Midnight 2 Filmmaker Nikkhil Advani discusses the challenges of portraying Partition in Freedom At Midnight 2. The series highlights the fear and trauma of Independence while blending archival footage with fiction.

general news.headline: BJP-Sena set to be Mumbai ka raja, Thackerays struggle, predict exit pollsBMC exit poll results: The Axis My India exit poll predicted 131-151 seats for the BJP-Shiv Sena combine. The reunion of the once-estranged Thackeray cousins after 20 years is unlikely to leave a mark in the elections held after seven years.

Stay vigilant, India cautions citizens in Israel amid rising Iran tensionsIn its advisory, the embassy asked Indian citizens to strictly follow safety guidelines and protocols issued by the Israeli authorities and the Home Front Command. Indian nationals were also advised to avoid all non-essential travel to Israel until further notice.

Canadian dies in Iran amid protests, Ottawa says Tehran disregards human lifeCanada's Foreign Minister Anita Anand said that a Canadian citizen has died in Iran at the hands of Iranian authorities. She, however, did not provide details of the incident. Calling for an end to the violence, Anand said Canada condemns the actions of the Iranian regime.

Suspected Pak drones spotted in J&K despite Army Chief warning, third this weekBesides Samba, another drone-like object was spotted over Degwar village in Poonch around 7:30 pm. The Indian Army fired a few rounds in an attempt to neutralise it.

US bans immigrant visas. But why are Thailand, Bhutan, Kuwait among 75 nations?The US has indefinitely paused immigrant visa processing for citizens of 75 countries, citing the financial burden on Americans. The inclusion of countries like Bhutan, Brazil, Kuwait and Thailand has surprised many, and sparked confusion over the criteria used to devise the list.

Tremors in Israel's Negev desert spark nuke-test buzz amid Iran crisisA shallow 4.2-magnitude quake in Israel's Negev desert near Dimona has sparked chatter about a nuclear test. Dimona is where Israel's nuclear facility is located. The tremors came even as the US threatened Iran with strikes amid protests by Iranians against the Khamenei regime. Iran considers Israel its mortal enemy, and would make it a target in case of any attack.

Come gather: ED cites WhatsApp chats to say TMC planned I-PAC hearing court chaosIn the chats accessed, a message circulated in the WhatsApp group "Legal Minds" read, "Everyone gather inside Court No. 5, Item No. 10." Soon after this clarion call for lawyers to assemble, another message was circulated urging everyone to join Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's rally against the ED raids at the I-PAC premises.

Border 2 trailer: Sunny Deol brings scale and sacrifice in multi-front war dramaBorder 2 trailer: The trailer for the Aurag Singh directorial was released on Army Day, showcasing India's 1971 war across land, sea and air, with Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahaan Panday and Diljit Dosanjh.

Who is Nisha Verma, doctor viral for response to can men get pregnant question?A Reproductive Health Adviser and senior figure associated with Physicians for Reproductive Health, Verma was born in an Indian immigrant family in North Carolina.

Severe cold wave to intensify on Friday, continue on SaturdayNorth India continues to battle severe cold wave conditions and dense fog. Expert Devendra Tripathi and IMD predict snowfall in the Himalayan region.

Live: European Union considering stronger sanctions against IranIran Protests Live Updates: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran has crossed 2,600 on Wednesday as Iranians were able to make phone calls abroad for the first time in days after authorities cut communications during a sweeping crackdown. The protests, which began more than two weeks ago over the country's struggling economy, have since broadened into direct opposition to the ruling theocracy, including Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Iranian state television issued its first indirect acknowledgement of the scale of the deaths, saying the country had suffered a lot of martyrs. While US President Donald Trump urged Iranians to keep protesting, saying help was on the way. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.
Trump told Tehran he doesn't want to attack, says Iran envoyThis diplomatic communication follows a period of mass demonstrations in Iran met with a forceful crackdown by authorities.
Nupur Sanon's wedding lehenga hid a special tribute for Stebin BenNupur Sanon paid a heartfelt tribute to Stebin Ben's cultural roots with a special message embroidered in Malayalam on her dupatta.

Dirty drop: Bird poop halts India Open match, day after monkey spotted in standsIndia Open 2026: The men's singles pre-quarters match between HS Prannoy and Loh Kean Yew was halted twice after bird droppings fell on the main court. The halts came days after the BAI assured the venue was pigeon-free, while responding to Denmark shuttler Mia Blichfeldt's allegations of unhygienic playing conditions in New Delhi.

Specially-abled man told to 'walk home' after lift breaks down at Mumbai metroA Mumbai man using a wheelchair was stranded at the Worli metro station for over 45 minutes due to a malfunctioning lift, sparking widespread concern about accessibility in public infrastructure.

Retire out to heroics: Harleen Deol seals UP Warriorz maiden win of WPL 2026WPL 2026, MI vs UPW: Harleen Deol scored an unbeaten 64 as the UP Warriorz opened their account with a seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Thursday in Navi Mumbai.

I breathe less: Ex-world champ Loh says Delhi air hurting players at India OpenFormer world champion Loh Kean Yew said Delhi's air pollution has impacted players' energy levels at the India Open. The tournament faces mounting criticism over conditions and hygiene from several top shuttlers.

It's a bloodbath: Iranians, cut off from world, send SOS amid violent protestsIranian protesters, defying a week-long internet blackout, have sent out an SOS describing a brutal crackdown on anti-Khamenei protests, with security forces using lethal force and fear gripping streets and homes across the country.

Air India plane engine sucks in cargo container, suffers damage on return to DelhiAccording to the Director General of Civil Aviation, the damage occurred after landing, while the aircraft was taxiing to the apron.

Honey Singh 'sorry' for viral explicit words: Meant to promote safe sex among Gen ZRapper Yo Yo Honey Singh issued a public apology after a remark made at a Delhi concert sparked criticism. In his video message, Honey Singh explained his intention behind the remark and claimed it was wrongly perceived by some people.

How BJP is trying to sink Mamata with her very own Singur scriptMonths before the 2026 Assembly elections in West Bengal, Mamata Banerjee's political nursery Singur has re-emerged as a flashpoint. The BJP has promised that it will bring Tata back to Singur, from where the company was forced to move to Gujarat after Mamata's movement in 2008. PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to address a rally in Singur on January 18, where farmers who had earlier protested, would be seated in the front row.

More positions than Kama Sutra: Keir Starmer's remarks at Conservatives sparks rowThe remarks prompted silence in the chamber, with many MPs and observers describing the moment as awkward and ill-judged.

This time bullet won't miss: Iranian TV airs chilling assassination threat to TrumpThe broadcast marked one of Tehran's most open threats yet to the US President amid reports that he is weighing military strikes against Iran. Iranian officials have accused Washington of using the country's internal unrest as a justification for possible intervention.

sports.headline: Harleen Deol reacts to retire out saga after heroics vs Mumbai Indians WPL 2026: 24 hours after being retired out against Delhi Capitals, Harleen Deol starred with an unbeaten 64 as UP Warriorz secured their first win, defeating Mumbai Indians by seven wickets.

Vidharbha storm in Vijay Hazare Trophy final, knock defending champion Karnataka out Vidarbha outplayed defending champions Karnataka with a dominant all-round display, clinching a six-wicket win to book their place in the Vijay Hazare Trophy final.

Rejuvenated Lakshya keeps India's hopes alive after rusty Sat-Chi crash out India Open 2026: Former champion Lakshya Sen stormed into the quarters, keeping India's hopes alive on a day when big guns, including Satwiksairaj Rankireddy-Chirag Shetty, KidambI Srikanth and HS Prannoy crashed out in New Delhi.

Smriti Mandhana returns to The Hundred Women, joins Manchester Super Giants Smriti Mandhana returns to The Hundred with Manchester Super Giants for 2026 after standout WPL form, bringing proven experience, big-match pedigree and elite top-order firepower to a star-studded squad.

Manoj Tiwary slams Mary Kom, responding to cheating claims, deletes video later Former cricketer Manoj Tiwary criticised Mary Kom for publicly disrespecting her ex-husband, saying her comments caused him pain and highlighted the importance of mutual support in relationships.

BWF backs Delhi for Badminton World C'ships, vows to address hygiene concerns The Badminton World Federation has backed Delhi to remain as the venue for the World Championships later in the year amid hygiene concerns during the India Open.

U19 World Cup: Henil, Kundu star but India off to shaky start with win over USA U19 World Cup 2026: India overcame a tricky chase against USA in the U19 World Cup as Abhigyan Kundu held firm and Henil Patel starred with a five-wicket haul. India won the rain-marred match by six wickets in the end via DLS method.

I breathe less: Ex-world champ Loh says Delhi air hurting players at India Open Former world champion Loh Kean Yew said Delhi's air pollution has impacted players' energy levels at the India Open. The tournament faces mounting criticism over conditions and hygiene from several top shuttlers.

Ashes hero Starc bags ICC award for his sensational performance vs England Mitchell Starc ended Australia's wait for an ICC Player Of The Month award as he was rewarded for his performance against England in the Ashes on Thursday, January 15. Starc was the Player Of The Series during the matches against England.

Neeraj Chopra begins pre-season training in South Africa after MOC approvalNeeraj Chopra, India's two-time Olympic medallist in javelin throw, has begun his 32-day pre-season training camp in Potchefstroom, South Africa, after receiving approval from the Sports Ministry's Mission Olympic Cell.

Kuldeep is No.1 spinner in the world: Chahal backs India star after Rajkot ODIYuzvendra Chahal has jumped to the defence of Kuldeep Yadav after his horror show during the Rajkot ODI against New Zealand on January 14. Kuldeep leaked runs and was the most expensive bowler in the game.

AIFF says ISL gets AFC recognition; ISL, Super Cup champions to get indirect slotsThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Thursday confirmed that the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has recognised the truncated 2025-26 Indian Super League, with winners of the ISL and Super Cup earning indirect entry into the AFC Champions League 2 via zonal qualifiers.

Dirty drop: Bird poop halts India Open match, day after monkey spotted in standsIndia Open 2026: The men's singles pre-quarters match between HS Prannoy and Loh Kean Yew was halted twice after bird droppings fell on the main court. The halts came days after the BAI assured the venue was pigeon-free, while responding to Denmark shuttler Mia Blichfeldt's allegations of unhygienic playing conditions in New Delhi.

Bangladesh Cricket Board sack director M Najmul Islam after players boycott BPLThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) on Thursday sacked director M Nazmul Islam, relieving him of all responsibilities, including his position as head of the finance committee, following demands from cricketers.

Mehidy Hasan slams BCB director over bizarre remarks: Shameful, inappropriateMehidy Hasan Miraz slammed BCB director M. Najmul Islam's "shameful" remarks on player compensation, triggering backlash from cricketers and boycott threats amid Bangladesh's T20 World Cup uncertainty.

India's Henil Patel wreaks havoc with sensational five-wicket haul vs USAIndia made a thunderous start to their ICC Under-19 World Cup campaign as Henil Patel spearheaded a ruthless bowling performance with a five-wicket haul to dismantle the USA for a paltry 107 in 35.2 overs on Thursday.

Nitish faces trolls, but finds backing from former India batter after Rajkot ODIFormer India batter Hanuma Vihari has jumped to the defence of Nitish Kumar Reddy after the all-rounder was trolled on social media, following his performance in the Rajkot ODI. Nitish didn't have a big role to play in the second match as New Zealand levelled the series.

How Daryl Mitchell prepared for India's white-ball tour in New ZealandIndia vs New Zealand: Batting mainstay Daryl Mitchell said training at New Zealand Cricket's marquee pitch facility in Lincoln helped him adapt to spin-friendly subcontinent conditions.

Bangladesh issue showcause to director as players revolt sees BPL game delayedBangladesh cricket remains in turmoil as players' revolt sees a BPL game get delayed with both teams yet to reach the stadium. The Bangladesh cricket board has issued a showcase notice to director Najmul Islam, whom the players want out of the organisation.

IND vs USA, U-19 World Cup Highlights: India off to nervy win as Henil, Kundu starIND vs USA U-19 World Cup live score: Abhigyan Kundu has got India over the line with a sensational knock as India start their campaign with a win. USA put on a brave fight with the ball but in the end, India's quality proved to be too much in the end.

Australian Open: Sinner, Djokovic on course for semi-final showdownJannik Sinner and Novak Djokovic are on course for a mouth-watering semi-final showdown at the Australian Open after the draw was revealed at Melbourne Park on Thursday.

Winless UP Warriorz seek revival against in-form Mumbai IndiansWPL 2026, MIW vs UPW Preview: UP Warriorz, still searching for their first win of the season, come into the match after a seven-wicket defeat to Delhi Capitals. Mumbai Indians, meanwhile, beat Gujarat Giants in their previous outing and have enjoyed a day's rest ahead of the clash.

Mohammad Rizwan should leave Big Bash League and return to Pakistan: Former batterKamran Akmal has called on Mohammad Rizwan to leave the Big Bash League due to his disappointing performance. The call highlights the pressure on Rizwan as he struggles to adapt to fast-paced T20 cricket and faces an uncertain future in Pakistan's T20 squad.

Daryll Mitchell continues to haunt India: Rajkot ODI adds to list of fruitful knockDaryl Mitchell struck another commanding century to haunt India yet again, guiding New Zealand to victory in Rajkot. His growing dominance against India now reads like a pattern rather than a coincidence.

T20 World Cup: England's preparations disrupted as Rashid, Ahmed await visasEngland's preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026 have been disrupted as spinners Adil Rashid and Rehan Ahmed face visa delays from India. They are set to tour Sri Lanka for a white-ball series ahead of the tournament.

Virat Kohli's priceless reaction as fan jumps barricades to meet him in RajkotDuring the second ODI at Rajkot, a fan breached security to meet Virat Kohli, who embraced him warmly. Despite Rahul's century, New Zealand chased down the target, leveling the series and setting up a thrilling decider.

Why Vaibhav Suryavanshi doesn't need the U19 World CupMost cricketers use the U19 World Cup to announce themselves. Vaibhav Suryavanshi arrives already battle-hardened, having faced the IPL, senior domestic cricket and international-quality bowling before turning 15.

India Open badminton: After pigeon-droppings, monkey spotted at Delhi stadiumA monkey was spotted inside the spectator gallery at the India Open badminton tournament. The incident has raised questions about venue security and playing conditions amid ongoing criticism.

Jallikattu 2026: Pramod Madhav On Strict Rules As 1,000 Bulls Enter The ArenaOn this Special Report, India Today Senior Correspondent Pramod Madhav reports from the ground as the traditional bull-taming sport, Jallikattu, begins in Tamil Nadu. Marking the commencement of the Pongal harvest season, the event in Avaniapuram features 1,000 registered bulls and 600 bull tamers. Madhav notes that 'No kind of any chemicals or drugs should not be used either by the bull tamer or on the bulls,' highlighting the strict medical tests and safety norms enforced following Supreme Court interventions. The report details the technicalities of the sport, where tamers must hold onto the bull's hump through the 'vadi vasal' entrance. As the state celebrates the harvest festival, the programme explores the cultural and spiritual significance of this annual athletic tradition, which remains a matter of deep faith for the people of Tamil Nadu.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
